intro: Berberis manipurensis, commonly known as the Manipur barberry, is a shrub native to the northeastern region of India. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the branches. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in spring, followed by red berries that are edible but often bitter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
